All of your examples are ridiculously off base because you can't even think of a way to counterplay anything other than by buying items. In other words, you're not even playing the game, you're just running at the enemy and right clicking, and then you're complaining because you can't buy an item that will win the game for you.

> how do we counter a knockup? WE CAN'T!

Dodge the tornado/spikes/slingshot/burrow/don't get auto attacked 3 times in a row by an easily peelable melee/etc. As you may notice, they're almost all skillshots, meaning you can move the mouse and click somewhere else and you won't get knocked up. Imagine that.

> HOW DO WE COUNTER HOURGLASS?(SITTING THERE FOR 2.5 SECS ISNT A COUNTER)  WE CAN'T!

Hit someone else, then toss a stun his way at 2.51 seconds.

> HOW DO WE COUNTER TRUE DMG? WE CAN'T (HP ISNT A COUNTER)

Dodge the skillshots. Counter true damage auto attacks the same way you counter all auto attacks: kite, cc, nuke, disengage (even more so for silver bolts, which even requires 3 uninterrupted auto attacks. If you can't figure out a way to **not get auto attacked 3 times in a row** you don't belong in a competitive game).

> HOW DO WE COUNTER CRITS? WE CAN'T!

Same way you counter all auto attacks: kite, cc, nuke, disengage.

Lissandra is ungankable and can initiate whenever she wants because of her E range and safety from her ult and w. She basically has a Zhonyas and Amumu ult combined into one ability.

Well, Liss is gankable and is definitely a lot easier to gank compared to Ezreal, LB, Fizz, Ahri, Heimerdinger, Syndra, Tryn, Shen, Swain, Kat, Lee Sin... The list goes on really. Many champions are incredible at escaping ganks due to the fact that they have incredible escapes with the exception to a few like Syndra, Heimer, and Swain who simply have perfectly disengage-then-reengage abilities. If Swain lands the W and follows up with a E+Q, the gank is not only over, but now he's getting a free kill off that jungler. Heimer is hilarious because he WANTS you to come near him and with your jungler being melee, they gotta get near his turrets to get near him and thus are taking free damage the entire time. Then there's of course Syndra who can very quickly drop a Q, then E+W+R for an incredibly fast combo that'll kill any non-pure tank jungler early on. If she doesn't have her R yet, well, she can still Q and E them away from her as well as stunning them in the process.

J4 has incredible mobility, damage, and CC. Pretty harsh kit. Could use some damage reductions.

Xin is a ganking jungler and provides nearly nothing to the game if he can't get fed off ganks. Unlike his counterpart J4, he doesn't have a bubble, his CC is a knock up and a knock back. The knock up requires 3 AA's and his knock back only applies to the targets he's NOT hitting with his AA's/E. He's pretty squishy without the bubble or bonus armor J4 has and his damage is heavily reliant on AA's and his gap closer isn't really that big of a range. His E does slow at least and with red, he can keep a target perma-slowed, but he suffers from Squishy Jungler Syndrome and is not a wise choice if the enemy is a Squishy Murderer like Fizz, Renekton, or Syndra. He also hates Heimer turrets. The Donger's turrets after landing that E will make the poor guy cry.

i think part of the issue is that riot seems to consider champion select a part of "counter play", which it shouldn't be. Champion select should give a base line of who has the advantage in the lane, but no champion should be so strong in the hyper early game (like before they recall for items the first time) that the only counter play to them is to counter pick them.
